intro: Rudgea ilheotica, commonly known as the Ilheus rudgea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in shaded undergrowth. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
